data.title: Cut and Copy in the Edit menu should only be active if some text is selected.
Atom.io pages should have dynamic page titles
data.body:
![atom page titles](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/823545/7445686/708f4458-f18b-11e4-82bb-b6385950ef96.png)

Those are all different pages on atom.io – no idea which is which. Pages on atom.io should have dynamic titles to reflect their content to avoid this kind of tab hell.

data.title: Adding Profiles to Atom
data.body: I was just thinking, in my workflow I work both at day and night, and depending on the time I prefer my editor to be either black or white, there are usually two sets of themes, but it looks like there isn't any easy and fast method of switching between this `modes`, so I am just wondering if it would be possible to create profiles for different modes of work and have shortcuts for them, they could also toggle installed packages aswell as selecting a particular theme for syntax and UI.

data.title: Debian package broken since 0.193
data.body:
Since 0.193 (last working version) the debian package is broken, or better: the atom editor which is installed via the package is broken. 

In X > 0.193 the editor starts per defaults with the chromium dev tools open (see attached screenshot). The following snipplets are from the latest git build (latest commit: bc0e5ad4c33c1a72470680b3478715513b6c0b46). The console states the following error/warning:

Error: Cannot find module '../build/Release/scrollbar-style-observer.node'
    at Module._resolveFilename (module.js:328:15)
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/module-cache.js:383:52)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:270:25)
    at Module.require (module.js:357:17)
    at require (module.js:376:17)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/scrollbar-style/lib/scrollbar-style.js:6:28)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/node_modules/scrollbar-style/lib/scrollbar-style.js:27:4)
    at Module._compile (module.js:452:26)
    at Object.loadFile [as .js](/usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/src/babel.js:162:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:347:32)

Indeed the .deb which was build via script/grunt mkdeb contains the follwing files (seee atom-0.197-deb-content.txt) - the missing scrollbar-style-observer.node is not there. (BTW: The .deb distributed via the official website is also affected). Compared these two debs with  the deb from 0.193 the file is there (atom-0.193-deb-content.txt). 

For me it looks like, as if something in the build process is broken and it would be cool to have a working editor back :-) 
![Uploading Bildschirmfoto von »2015-04-29 22:01:17«.png…]()

data.title: An idea for easing the coming deprecation apocolypse
data.body:
I have an idea for reducing the number of deprecations that make it to June 1.  See this [thread](https://discuss.atom.io/t/deprecated-atom-apis-will-be-removed-on-june-1st/16526).

I am considering gathering a list of all deprecated method names and then writing a utility that scans the source of a package for remaining deprecations.  This would find all of them instead of the current process that misses ones not hit during testing.

This idea gets kind of weird.  I'm considering running it automatically on _all_ published packages and emailing the authors who still have offending code.  The email would contain an easy-to-use list of offenses with file-names/line-numbers and some surrounding lines of code.

Comments?  Should I do this?

data.title: No results when searching rvm gems directory (multi-user install)
data.body:
I have install rvm (doing a multi-user install) into /usr/local.
Then I created gemsets for each of my projects.

When opening a gem's directory with atom
`EDITOR=atom bundle open [gem_name]` and try to search something with cmd+shift+f nothing ever shows up in the results even though the search term exists in several files.

Could this be an issue with file/directory permissions due to the multi-user install?
Any ideas how to debug/fix?

data.title: Bring to Front
data.body: When Atom is restored but hidden behind several windows.  "Open with Atom" right click function should send it to the front.

data.title: [Windows] Squirrel icon stays up after reading changelog
data.body:
Did I understand it correctly that the Squirrel icon in the status bar should go away after you read the changelog after updating? 

If so, the icon stays up even through me reading the changelog a few times, closing it's tab and reopening it from the icon.

If not, maybe it should go away after you read it once.

data.body:
all it does is close and update, never restarts for me.

Tested with .193 => .196

data.title: Built in reopen function not working with project manager
data.body:
As the topic says. In contrast, the community package reopen-last-project does open the project I was last working on.
The project manager uses full path, not relative, so I have no idea why the difference.

data.title: Request: map cmd/alt + 9 to show last (rightmost) tab
data.body:
I wanted to see what people thought about remapping this key combination to instead to to the last tab open in a pane. Currently, it is set to [view the ninth tab](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/keymaps/darwin.cson#L103): `'cmd-9': 'pane:show-item-9'`

My reasons for suggesting are as follows:
- I believe it is easier to have a dedicated key to always go to this specific position, as compared to counting how many tabs from the left your desired tab is
- if someone has more than nine tabs open, a keymapping to go directly to the end would be beneficial
- Atom shares many existing keyboard shortcuts with Chrome, and Chrome uses this key combination to navigate to the last tab

Curious to hear your thoughts on it. Thanks.

data.title: Can't override alt-delete/alt-backspace
data.body:
Adding this to my keymap.cson file has no effect:

``` cson
'atom-text-editor':
  'alt-delete': 'editor:delete-to-next-word-boundary'
  'alt-backspace': 'editor:delete-to-previous-word-boundary'
```

When I hit alt-delete, it still does the default `editor:delete-to-end-of-word`.

data.title: slow opening JSON document
data.body:
opening and editing a JSON file is slow. seems more slow than it should be considering it's only bout 60k in size. I would attach the file but can't. It's nothing fancy, but here it is. In fact this textarea form reads the data in faster :-(

See https://gist.github.com/thomasjo/9b88cb2ee1e94f9f002f

---

**NOTE:** inline file removed by @thomasjo, and moved to a Gist.

data.title: Minor oddity: installed in the future?
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7933750/7436375/732afd9a-f04d-11e4-993f-941ecc7be02c.png)

When I wanted to remove a recently installed program, I encountered this. 
`Start` > `Control Panel` > `Remove a program` then sorted on date ascending.

It says it's installed on October 1st this year (Dutch date notation is `dd-mm-yyyy`). That's in the future, cause it's May 1st today. I installed it a couple of weeks ago (April 15th).

> Windows 7 64bits
> Atom 0.196.0

data.title: Add setting to disable restoring last session
data.body:
It's useful that atom can remember the files/folders you had open last time and then re-open them next time you start atom. I can't seem to figure out how to turn off this behavior though, I generally _want_ to start clean each time I open atom.

Is there a config option to enable/disable this feature? Or could we implement a dialog box when closing atom that asks if you want it to remember what you had open?

data.body:
[Enter steps to reproduce below:]
1. Open editor from command line using git with it as default commit editor.

**Atom Version**: 0.196.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.3
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

```

Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar'
    at Error (native)
    at fs.openSync (fs.js:544:18)
    at Object.fs.readFileSync (ATOM_SHELL_ASAR.js:402:12)
    at Object.loadFile [as .js] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/babel.js:138:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:347:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:302:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:357:17)
    at require (module.js:376:17)
    at Package.module.exports.Package.requireMainModule (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package.js:691:34)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package.js:170:28
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "themes": [
      "atom-dark-ui",
      "one-dark-syntax"
    ]
  },
  "editor": {
    "invisibles": {},
    "fontSize": 15
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
No installed packages

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: Cmd-p index finds wrong file
data.body:
I am using Atom 0.194.0 on Mac OS X 10.10.

I open a project directory. I then type Cmd-p and type,

```
settings.ini
```

However, the selected file in the index is:

```
settings.template
```

If I then press enter, the wrong file is loaded.

data.title: Remove Completions from Settings
data.body: We don't really need these here (and it can be confusing) as languages can define them. _before_ Closes https://github.com/atom/settings-view/issues/353

data.title: Normalize all package.json data
data.body:
Normalize all package.json data—essentially parse it the same as npm.

Opening an issue since it was discussed on a merged PR.

:link: https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/6582#issuecomment-98002558

data.title: Add a "package load paths" config for using packages in custom locations
data.body:
Atom should load packages in the specified folders in addition to the packages in "~/.atom/packages" on startup.

Internally, we've been developing packages in a custom folder and symlinking them into "~/.atom/packages" when we want to run them. The symlinks get out of date when we add packages, move them around, or delete them. It would be nice if we could just point Atom to look for packages in our development folders.

data.title: Feature request: Remove multiple project folders.
data.body:
Add a project folder, add a different project folder, right click on both.

No option for "remove project folders" appears.

data.title: Missing icon in Linux
data.body:
After doing

```
script/grunt install --installdir=/usr/local
```

there are no icons for the atom launcher.

The .desktop file **/usr/local/share/applications/atom.desktop** references the icon at **/usr/local/share/atom/resources/app/resources/atom.png** but the folder **app/resources** does not exist.

data.title: Developer tools won't open
data.body:
Recently started having an issue where whenver I launch developer tools, it doesn't show anything.
It shows that the window is in fact "open" in my taskbar, but doesn't actually have anything inside of it.
![atom-devtools](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8135396/7430791/7f4c5d46-f00f-11e4-9918-3ce196cae51c.jpg)

Things were working fine when I was on 0.194 (am on 0.196 at the moment)
Atom v0.196
Windows 7 Pro SP1 x64

Disabling all packages and using default themes make no difference either.

Anyone else having this issue?

data.title: Font width is not refreshed on startup
data.body:
How to reproduce:
1. Have user stylesheet with custom editor font set
2. Start new editor, previously opened buffers are restored
3. Cursor and selection position does not match rendered text

Way to fix:
1. When I re-open same buffer again, it works OK.

---

I am using Atom `v0.196.0` on GNU Operating System
